gov.va.isaac.util

Class PasswordHasher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.isaac.util.PasswordHasher

  • public class PasswordHasher
extends Object
    PasswordHasher A safe, modern way to 1-way hash user passwords. Adapted and enhanced from http://stackoverflow.com/a/11038230/2163960 Later, added the ability to encrypt and decrypt arbitrary data - using many of the same techniques.
    Author:
    Dan Armbrust

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PasswordHasher() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean check(String password, String stored)
      Checks whether given plaintext password corresponds to a stored salted hash of the password.
      static String computeChecksum(String type, byte[] data)
      Type can be any supported type, like 'MD5' or 'SHA1'
      static byte[] decrypt(String password, String encryptedData) 
      static String decryptToString(String password, String encryptedData) 
      static String encrypt(String password, byte[] data) 
      static String encrypt(String password, String data) 
      static String getSaltedHash(String password)
      Computes a salted PBKDF2 hash of given plaintext password suitable for storing in a database.

    • Method Detail

      • getSaltedHash

        public static String getSaltedHash(String password)
                            throws Exception
        Computes a salted PBKDF2 hash of given plaintext password suitable for storing in a database. Empty passwords are not supported.
        Throws:
        Exception
